subject: Defective clutch, pro x pedals.
description_text:
I recently bought a set of pro x pedals and have been using them for a
while now with no issue, just a few days ago I updated the simsonn software
and now I'm having some issues.
My PC detects 8 inputs from the pedals and one of them is always centered.
The clutch LEDs work and I can see the white position line move in the
software when pressed. But no input is detected, no bottom end option on
the dead zone slider, no movement on the graph.

I've tried a few things,
plug the gas into the clutch port and vise versa, so it seems to be the
port on the control box not the sensor itself.
Restarts, reinstalls, other software versions.
Still no clutch input.

Is there any way I could get some help?

Best regards.

conversations.body_text: Hi Jack Broome,     Please use the test version 2.1.1 and click Revert → Save, then recalibrate and test again to check whether Axis 4 is disabled. If not, you may try refreshing the firmware manually: go to Settings → Update → Manual Firmware Update → pedals-firmware, and select the corresponding prox.sfu firmware file. Please avoid using version 2.1.1 for now—we will release an online update soon, as other versions may mistakenly re-enable Axis 4.      https://drive.google.com/file/d/1UPkeOHREyALtCtNmL87a2WnUDZV0Gx_b/view?usp=drive_link
